name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
currentCrisisSummary:
Eastern DRC is the epicentre of a deadly contest over vast **mineral wealth** (cobalt, coltan etc.) essential to **global tech supply chains**. This fuels '**green colonialism**': the Global North's energy transition depends on minerals extracted through **violence, dispossession, and child labour**. Armed control over mines links **multinational companies** to a system that **extracts value while externalising human cost**.

The conflict involves the army, militias, and **foreign-backed groups** (M23). **Regional interference** (Rwanda, Uganda) fuels violence and mass displacement. Sexual violence is endemic. Suffering is catastrophic, caused by the **scramble for minerals** and **geopolitical manoeuvring**. **Accountability** for **illicit resource exploitation** remains minimal. Solutions require halting **external military interference**, enforcing **corporate accountability**, and centring **Congolese-led justice**.

colonialRoot.legacy:
The crisis is rooted in Belgium's **extraction-first colonial project**. King Leopold II's **Congo Free State** unleashed **forced labour** and violence for **resource extraction**. Belgian state rule continued a **political economy designed for extraction**.

**Colonial institutions** prioritised mineral concessions and segregated labour, hollowing out public institutions. The post-independence state inherited weak structures and **externally oriented extraction models**, making it vulnerable to predatory actors seeking **mineral rents**.

historicalContext.title: The Cold War and Kleptocracy
historicalContext.description: After **Lumumba's assassination**, the West backed the 32-year **dictatorship** of Mobutu Sese Seko. As a **Cold War client**, Mobutu received Western aid for anti-communist alignment and access for **foreign corporations**. He perfected **kleptocracy**, embezzling billions while the state disintegrated. Post-**Cold War**, abandoned by patrons and crippled by **odious debt**, the country faced **IMF-led Structural Adjustment Programmes** (**austerity**), sealing the **state's total collapse** and leading to the Congo Wars.

historicalContext.title: Conflict Minerals and Foreign Influence
historicalContext.description: Eastern Congo's **mineral wealth** involves militias, regional interests, and global markets. Armed groups control mines and smuggle minerals into supply chains. Investigations link **extractive industries** to rights violations (**forced evictions**, **labour abuses**). Demand for minerals fuels conflict and **foreign interference**. **Corporate due-diligence gaps** allow this to persist.

historicalContext.title: International Law And Accountability
historicalContext.description: Multiple mechanisms engage. The **UN Group of Experts** documents regional support for armed groups and **illicit resource exploitation**. Investigations expose abuses, but systemic **accountability** is limited. Remedies need criminal accountability and structural reforms (**resource governance**, **corporate responsibility**, **reparations**).

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Millions estimated dead since the late 1990s, victims of **wars driven by the scramble for mineral wealth and regional power.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Roughly 25.4 million require aid due to **systematic destruction caused by decades of resource conflict.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: Nearly 7 million internally displaced, uprooted by **violence linked to control over mines.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 1 million refugees forced abroad by **conflict resulting from state decay and foreign interference.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Education Lost
humanitarianImpact.description: Millions of children denied education by **conflict over resources.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Sexual Violence as Weapon
humanitarianImpact.description: Sexual violence used **systematically as a tool of terror** by armed groups fighting over mineral areas.

humanitarianImpact.title: Economic Devastation
humanitarianImpact.description: Mining communities suffer **dispossession, forced labour, and poverty** as armed groups and corporations exploit resources.

timeline.event: **Congo Free State**: King Leopold II establishes the Congo Free State as his private possession. The concessionary extraction regime and forced labour policies cause catastrophic population loss and trauma.
**Belgian Colonial Rule**: The Belgian state takes formal control and continues an extraction-centred governance model that privileges foreign companies and creates weak local institutions.
**Independence & Crisis**: The DRC gains independence. Political turmoil, secessionist movements and foreign interference quickly destabilise the new state.

**Assassination of Patrice Lumumba**: The first prime minister is removed and murdered with foreign complicity, a pivotal moment that undercut Congo's early pursuit of independent resource sovereignty.

**The Mobutu Era**: Supported by the West as a Cold War client, Mobutu Sese Seko establishes a decades-long kleptocratic dictatorship. He loots the nation's mineral wealth, plunges the country into debt, and presides over the total decay of the state, creating the vacuum that leads to the Congo Wars.

**Regional Wars & Resource Wars**: The First and Second Congo Wars draw in multiple neighbouring states and armed groups, driven in part by competition over mineral wealth and regional power contests.

**Persistent Violence & Armed Groups**: Eastern provinces host scores of armed groups contesting land, mines and influence. International and corporate supply chains increasingly draw attention to human-rights abuses linked to mineral extraction.

**UN Group of Experts Reports**: UN panels and Security Council reporting document patterns of illicit resource exploitation and regional support for armed groups, naming actors and networks involved in cross-border dynamics.

**Escalation and Displacement**: Renewed advances by M23 and other armed actors trigger mass displacement, the capture of towns and cities in the east, and a sharp rise in protection needs and civilian suffering.

donate.description: A Congolese-led advocacy organisation that raises global awareness and supports local institutions and Congolese voices.
Founded by Dr Denis Mukwege, Panzi provides medical, psychosocial and legal support to survivors of sexual violence and their families.
Focuses on protecting vulnerable children from abuse and exploitation, providing education, and helping former child soldiers reintegrate into their communities.

advocacy.title: Demand Corporate Accountability
advocacy.description: Press for independent, enforceable corporate due diligence across mineral supply chains and demand transparency from tech and automotive companies about sourcing.

advocacy.title: Sanction External Enablers
advocacy.description: Support targeted sanctions and diplomatic pressure against external actors found to be materially supporting armed groups, while protecting humanitarian access.

advocacy.title: Amplify Congolese Voices
advocacy.description: Amplify Congolese civil-society voices and support local organisations that lead relief, protection and accountability work.

advocacy.title: Call for Reparations
advocacy.description: Call for reparative measures from states and corporations that profited from exploitative extraction and colonial-era abuses.

advocacy.title: Support Local Development
advocacy.description: Promote conflict-sensitive, community-led development that prioritises land rights, local stewardship of resources and diversification beyond raw-extraction economies.

reading.title: *King Leopold's Ghost: A Story of Greed, Terror, and Heroism in Colonial Africa*
reading.description: Adam Hochschild's essential account of the brutal exploitation of the Congo Free State under Belgian rule.

reading.title: *Cobalt Red: How the Blood of the Congo Powers Our Lives*
reading.description: Siddharth Kara's investigation linking cobalt mining in the DRC to corporate supply chains, labour abuses, and environmental harms ('green colonialism').

reading.title: *Dancing in the Glory of Monsters: The Collapse of the Congo and the Great War of Africa*
reading.description: Jason Stearns provides a definitive account of the Congo Wars, analysing the complex regional dynamics of conflict, resource extraction, and state failure.

reading.title: *The Assassination of Lumumba*
reading.description: Ludo De Witte's research exposing the role of Belgian and US intelligence services in the murder of Patrice Lumumba.
